content: the court of appeals in venice made a final ruling on a case involving the division of a real estate property they upheld the appeal and annulled parts of the previous decision the court ordered the undivided ownership of the property to be assigned to the plaintiffs who were also instructed to pay a settlement amount to the defendant additionally the plaintiffs were given sixty days to release a portion of the property the court determined that the property could not be divided and rejected the defendants request for a different allocation the plaintiffs had initially requested the entire property but the court found it to be indivisible the court considered unsuccessful attempts to sell the property at auction and decided to assign it to the plaintiffs the defendant appealed the decision claiming errors in determining the settlement amount and the deadline for releasing the property the appellees joined the proceedings and requested the appeal to be declared inadmissible however the court rejected the defendants arguments and confirmed the previous judgment the court also noted that the plaintiffs had withdrawn their request for the entire property a new assessment of the propertys value and feasibility of division was ordered ultimately the court upheld the division of the property and rejected the appeal the court also awarded the plaintiffs reimbursement for their litigation costs an objection raised by the appellees regarding the admissibility of the case was rejected the court remanded the case for further investigation the final ruling was made on september 8 2020 and filed in the clerks office on september 11 2020
